component.text: <font color="#FFFFFF">The primary vulnerabilities for end-user workstations are virus, worm, and Trojan Horse attacks.</font>

<font color="#FFFFFF">A worm executes arbitrary code and installs copies of itself in the memory of the infected computer. The main purpose of a worm is to automatically replicate itself and spread across the network from system to system.</font>
<font color="#FFFFFF">A virus is malicious software which executes a specific unwanted, and often harmful, function on a computer.</font>

<font color="#FFFFFF">A Trojan horse is a non-self-replicating type of malware. It often contains malicious code that is designed to look like something else, such as a legitimate application or file. When an infected application or file is downloaded and opened, the Trojan horse can attack the end device from within.</font>
